thread.title: 14 Subway Lines Slated For Service Changes This Weekend
thread.title_full: 14 Subway Lines Slated For Service Changes This Weekend

title: 14 Subway Lines Slated For Service Changes This Weekend
text:
14 Subway Lines Slated For Service Changes This Weekend By Ben Fractenberg | June 9, 2016 2:42pm | Updated January 6, 2017 11:59am View Full Caption DNA/Stephanie Keith 
NEW YORK CITY â€” A new year is upon us, but the weekend subway service changes are a steady reminder that some things endure. This weekend could be a good time to start your New Year's resolution to walk more with 16 lines facing disruptions. 
SKIP TO YOUR SUBWAY HERE: 1 Train ; 2 Train ; 3 Train ; 4 Train ; 5 Train ; 7 Train ; C Train ; E Train ; D Train ; F Train ; G Train ; L Train ; N Train ; R Train 
1 Train : Service will be suspended in both directions between 14th Street and South Ferry from 11:30 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Riders can take a 2 or 3 train or free shuttle bus between Chambers Street and South Ferry. 
2 Train: Trains will run local in both directions between Chambers Street and 34th Street from 11:30 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
Southbound trains will skip Jackson Avenue from 4:45 a.m. to 10 a.m. Sunday. 
3 Train : Service will be suspended in both directions between Crown Heights-Utica Avenue and New Lots Avenue from 11:30 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Free shuttle buses will provide alternate service. 
Trains will run local in both directions between Chambers Street and 34th Street from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
Trains will skip Sutter Avenue-Rutland Road and Junius Street both ways until further notice. Use free shuttle buses instead. 
For service to/from Sutter Avenue, free shuttles will run between that station and Crown Heights-Utica Avenue. 
For service to/from Junius Street, free shuttles will run between Junius and Rockaway Avenue at all hours. 
Trains will also skip Pennsylvania Avenue in both directions. Free shuttle buses will run between Pennsylvania and Van Siclen avenues at all times. B20 and B83 riders can transfer to/from these free shuttles at Pennsylvania. A free transfer will be available with a MetroCard. 
4 Train : Service will run local in both directions between 125th Street and Brooklyn Bridge from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
Service will be suspended between Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall and New Lots Avenue from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Riders can take a 2, 3, D, J, N, Q, R or shuttle bus for alternate service. D, N, Q and R trains will provide service between Manhattan and Brooklyn and 3 trains will provide service between Franklin Avenue and Crown Heights-Utica Avenue. 
Trains will skip Sutter Avenue-Rutland Road and Junius Street both ways until further notice. Use free shuttle buses instead. 
For service to/from Sutter Avenue, free shuttles will run between that station and Crown Heights-Utica Avenue. 
For service to/from Junius Street, free shuttles will run between Junius and Rockaway Avenue at all hours. 
Trains will also skip Pennsylvania Avenue both ways. Free shuttle buses will run between Pennsylvania and Van Siclen avenues at all times. B20 and B83 riders can transfer to/from these free shuttles at Pennsylvania. A free transfer will be available with a MetroCard. 
5 Train: Service will be suspended between East 180th Street and Dyre Avenue from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Free shuttle buses will provide alternate service. 
Service will be suspended between 42nd Street-Grand Central Terminal and Bowling Green from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. Saturday and from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Sunday. Riders can take a 4, 6 or R train for alternate service. 
Trains will be suspended between 149th Street-Grand Concourse and East 180th Street from 7:45 a.m. to 10 a.m. Sunday. Take a 2 train for alternate service. 
7 Train : Flushing-bound trains will run express from Queensboro Plaza to 74th Street-Broadway from 3:45 a.m. Saturday to 10 p.m. Sunday. 
C Train : Service will be suspended between Manhattan and Brooklyn from 6:30 a.m. to midnight Saturday and Sunday. Trains will be rerouted over the F line between West 4th Street and Second Avenue. 
E Train : Trains will be rerouted over the F line from in both directions between West 4th Street and 21st Street-Queensbridge from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Free shuttle buses will run between Court Square-23rd Street and 21st Street Queensbridge. 
D Train : Coney Island-bound trains will run express from Atlantic Avenue-Barclays Center to 36th Street in Brooklyn from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 6:30 a.m. Sunday and from 11:45 p.m. Sunday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
F Train : Service will be suspended in both directions between Coney Island-Stillwell Avenue and Jay Street-MetroTech from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. Riders can take a G train at Hoyt-Schermerhorn Streets for alternate service. 
Until early 2017, Coney Island-bound F trains will skip Avenue I, Bay Parkway, Avenue N, Avenue P, Avenue U and Avenue X. To get to these stops, take a Coney Island-bound F to Kings Highway or Neptune Avenue and transfer to a Queens-bound train. For service from these stops, take a Queens-bound F to Kings Highway or 18th Avenue and transfer to a Coney Island-bound train. 
G Train : Service will operate to and from Coney Island from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday, replacing the F train. 
L Train : Service will be suspended in both directions between Eighth Avenue and 14th Street-Union Square from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. The M14 bus will provide alternate service. 
N Train : Coney Island-bound trains will run express from Atlantic Avenue-Barclays Center to 59th Street in Brooklyn from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 6:30 a.m. Sunday and from 11:45 p.m. Sunday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
Until the spring, Queens-bound N trains will skip 86th Street, Avenue U, Kings Highway, 20th Avenue, 18th Avenue, New Utrecht Avenue and Fort Hamilton Parkway. N trains will stop at Bay Parkway and Eighth Avenue. 
To get to 86th Street, Avenue U and Kings Highway, take a Queens-bound N to Bay Parkway and transfer to a Coney Island-bound train. 
To get to 20th Avenue, 18th Avenue, New Utrecht Avenue and Fort Hamilton Parkway, take a Queens-bound train to Eighth Avenue and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. 
From these stops, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Parkway or Stillwell Avenue and transfer to a Queens-bound N. 
To get to New Utrecht-62nd Street, take the D to a Queens-bound N at 36th Street. 
R Train : Bay Ridge-bound trains will run express from Atlantic Avenue-Barclays Center to 59th Street in Brooklyn from 11:45 p.m. Friday to 5 a.m. Monday. 
Service will run to and from the Jamaica-179th Street F train station from 6:30 a.m. to midnight Saturday and Sunday.
